metadata.title: CVE-2021-47353 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: udf:Fix NULL pointer dereference in udf_symlink function In functionudf_symlink, epos.bh is assigned with the value returned by udf_tgetblk.The function udf_tgetblk is defined in udf/misc.c and returns the value ofsb_getblk function that could be NULL. Then, epos.bh is used without anycheck, causing a possible NULL pointer dereference when sb_getblk fails.This fix adds a check to validate the value of epos.bh.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47353` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-156-generic - 4.15.0-156.163~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-156-generic - 4.15.0-156.163~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-156-lowlatency - 4.15.0-156.163~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1111-aws - 4.15.0-1111.118~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1123-azure - 4.15.0-1123.136~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1108-gcp - 4.15.0-1108.122~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1080-oracle - 4.15.0-1080.88~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-156.163~16.04.1').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1111.118~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1123.136~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1108.122~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1080.88~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
